verses.roman:
guruṇaivam anujñātau
rathenānila-raṁhasā
āyātau sva-puraṁ tāta
parjanya-ninadena vai

synonyms: guruṇā—by Their spiritual master; evam—in this way; anujñātau—given leave; rathena—in Their chariot; anila—like the wind; raṁhasā—whose speed; āyātau—came; sva—to Their own; puram—city (Mathurā); tāta—my dear (King Parīkṣit); parjanya—like a cloud; ninadena—whose reverberation; vai—indeed.
translation: Thus receiving Their guru's permission to leave, the two Lords returned to Their city on Their chariot, which moved as swiftly as the wind and resounded like a cloud.
